findings.title: Potential namespace collisions through token symbol
findings.description: Tokens are identified by their symbol in both EthereumBank.sol and CosmosBank.sol, leading to namespace collisions.

findings.title: Missing checks for maximum consensus threshold
findings.description: No maximum is enforced for the consensus threshold, which can lead to unreachable consensus.

findings.title: Malleable signatures
findings.description: The verify() function in Valset.sol uses the built-in ecrecover() function, which allows malleable signatures.

findings.title: Duplicate validators are accepted in validator set
findings.description: The Valset.sol contract does not check for duplicate validator additions, producing inconsistencies related to voting power and consensus.

findings.title: Ether transfers depending on gas stipend may not work if the recipient is a smart contract
findings.description: The transfer() function in EthereumBank.sol uses a fixed gas stipend that may be insufficient for smart contract recipients.

findings.title: Compiler version
findings.description: The code uses an outdated compiler version (pragma solidity ^0.5.0;).

findings.title: Misleading behavior for recoverGas function
findings.description: The refund is capped at half the transaction cost, making it misleading.

findings.title: Bridge bank can receive ETH directly
findings.description: The BridgeBank.sol contract has a leftover test code that allows direct ETH receipt.

findings.title: Unnecessary modifier
findings.description: EthereumBank.sol has an unnecessary modifier for avoiding nonce overflow.

findings.title: Unnecessary protection in view function
findings.description: The checkBridgeProphecy() function checks the caller, but it's a view function and doesnâ€™t change state.

findings.title: Optimization on token deployment costs
findings.description: Token deployment can be optimized using a proxy pattern.

findings.title: Consider using a mock address for ETH
findings.description: Using a mock address (0xeeeee...) instead of 0x0 for ETH would avoid confusion with uninitialized addresses.

findings.title: Incorrect natspect comments
findings.description: Functions burnFunds() and lockFunds() have incorrect natspec comments.

findings.title: Node package inclusion in Solidity files breaks build system
findings.description: Relative path imports break the build system; direct import is recommended.

findings.title: Outdated indirect dependency with multiple known security vulnerabilities
findings.description: The codebase uses an outdated version of the ecdt library with known vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Relayer quits silently on failure to connect to subscribe to Ethereum events
findings.description: The relayer terminates silently if Ethereum connection fails, making monitoring and automatic relaunch difficult.

findings.title: Missing default case in switch statement
findings.description: A default case is missing in the switch statement for processing Ethereum event data.

findings.title: Empty code blocks
findings.description: Unimplemented functions are marked as TODO, which should be avoided in production code.
